meta.name: description
meta.content: Kern High School District (KHSD) serves 9-12th grade students and is located in Bakersfield, CA.

nav.a: Apply for Free & Reduced Price Meals

div.p:
Because of the COVID-19 health crisis, Kern High School District school sites will be closed to students for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Please note the following schools will provide "grab & go" meals. Meal Distribution Sites as of Tuesday, April 14, 2020, Monday-Thursday
Arvin High School
Bakersfield High School
Frontier High School
Golden Valley High School
Independence High School
Kern Valley High School
Mira Monte High School
North High School
Nueva High School
Shafter High School
South High School
Stockdale High School
West High School
Students need to be present to receive their meals.
School site offices will also be closed through the remainder of the school year & will be very minimally staffed. Please call the school site number available on the KHSD website if you need to request assistance. This number is also posted on the front entry to the school site.
If you have questions concerning current school closures, please email them to SchoolClosure@kernhigh.org. We will continue to keep you updated as new information comes in.

div.h2: Ag Welding at Independence High School

img.alt: COVID-19 Updates & Information - Updated 4/13/2020 Thumbnail Image

div.div:
Because of the COVID-19 health crisis, Kern High School District school sites will be closed to students for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year. Please note the following schools will provide "grab & go" meals. Meal Distribution Sites as of Tuesday, April 14, 2020, Monday-Thursday Arvin High School Bakersfield High School Frontier High School Golden Valley High School Independence High School Kern Valley High School Mira Monte High School North High School Nueva High School Shafter High School South High School Stockdale High School West High School Students need to be present to receive their meals.
School site offices will also be closed through the remainder of the school year & will be very minimally staffed. Please call the school site number available on the KHSD website if you need to request assistance. This number is also posted on the front entry to the school site.
If you have questions concerning current school closures, please email them to SchoolClosure@kernhigh.org. We will continue to keep you updated as new information comes in.

h1.a: KHSD News for April 17, 2020: Distance learning inspires creativity, inspirational messages, and BHS coach receives state honor

img.alt: KHSD News for April 17, 2020: Distance learning inspires creativity, inspirational messages, and BHS coach receives state honor Thumbnail Image

div.div: This week's KHSD News, we take a closer look at distance learning and how teachers and students are getting creative in their virtual classrooms. We will also show you the way students and staff are paying tribute to seniors during this challenging time, the state honor presented to a Bakersfield High coach, plus, we highlight many more accomplishments of our students, staff, and schools.

h1.a: KHSD News: Schools help connect students, staff and students get creative during school closures

img.alt: KHSD News: Schools help connect students, staff and students get creative during school closures Thumbnail Image

div.div: In this week's KHSD News, we highlight the innovative ways schools and other departments are making sure students stay connected. Plus, staff and students are letting their creative juices flow and create videos of hope, and the way students can still join Happiness Hangouts without leaving their home.

h1.a: KGET highlights KHSD plans to connect students to WiFi

img.alt: KGET highlights KHSD plans to connect students to WiFi Thumbnail Image

div.div: The Kern High School District is rolling out buses to act as WiFi hotspots in our community.
Location: Board Room in EOC Building
Location: KHSD Emergency Operations Center / Board Room
Location: KHSD Emergency Operations Center / Board Room
Location: Board Room in EOC Building

div.style: background-image: url(https://3.files.edl.io/6372/17/06/06/172718-aec5520a-a941-446b-bec9-a60e9642d8a9)

section.div: The mission of the Kern High School District is to provide programs and services to allow ALL students to graduate from high school prepared to succeed in the workplace and at the post-secondary level.

div.div:
KHSD's commitment to CTE from 2015 to 2018 has resulted in:
• A 60% growth in the number of program offerings at our premier CTE capstone campus (Regional Occupational Center)
• New and varied CTE offerings at our 18 comprehensive sites
• New and dynamic partnerships with local industry partners

div.style: background-image: url(https://3.files.edl.io/e74e/17/06/06/172718-c6e654f0-9c02-453e-b2b0-d6dc409fd144)

nav.a: Nondiscrimination Policies (Title IX/Sexual Harassment) (Title IX/Sexual Harassment)

img.alt: WASC Accredation logo

div.div:
The Kern High School District (KHSD) is committed to ensuring equal, fair, and meaningful access to employment and education services. KHSD prohibits discrimination, harassment (including sexual harassment), intimidation, or bullying in any employment practice, education program, or educational activity on the basis and/or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics of age, ancestry, color, ethnic group identification, gender, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical information, national origin, physical or mental disability, parental status, political affiliation, pregnancy and related conditions, race, religion, retaliation, sex, sexual orientation, Military Veterans status, homelessness, foster status, or any other basis prohibited by California state and federal nondiscrimination laws consistent with Education Code 200 and 220, Government Code 11135, and Title IX.
If you believe you have been subjected to discrimination, harassment (including sexual harassment), intimidation, or bullying you should contact your school site principal and/or the District's Chief Equity Compliance and Title IX Officer, Dr. Dean McGee, 5801 Sundale Avenue, (661) 827-3149, dmcgee@kernhigh.org. A copy of KHSD's Uniform Complaint policy and Nondiscrimination policy are available at www.kernhigh.org and upon request.
